events.name: Panchami
events.desc: Panchami (21 Poh 556) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Guru Gobind Singh Prakash
events.desc: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Gobind Singh ji (23 Poh 556) - The sacred birth anniversary of the tenth Guru of the Sikhs, revered for his establishment of the Khalsa Panth in 1699, which gave Sikhs their distinct identity through the Five Ks. As a spiritual master, warrior-saint, poet, and philosopher, He authored numerous compositions including the Dasam Granth and completed the canonization of the Sri Guru Granth Sahib. His teachings emphasize spiritual discipline, social justice, and the equality of all human beings.

events.name: Dashmi
events.desc: Dashmi (26 Poh 556) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Lohri
events.desc: Puranmashi, Lohri (30 Poh 556) - A popular winter folk festival celebrated in the Punjab region, often associated with the harvest and the end of winter.

events.name: Sangrand (Magh), Sri Harimandir Sahib Foundation Day
events.desc: Foundation day Sachkhand Sri Harimandir Sahib (Amritsar), Jor Mela Sri Muktsar Sahib (Maghi) (01 Magh 556) - Sri Harmandir Sahib, also known as the Golden Temple, was founded by Sri Guru Arjan Dev Ji in 1581. It represents the spiritual and temporal seat of Sikh faith, embodying the principles of equality, harmony, and divine wisdom. The architecture symbolizes the Sikh vision of humility and openness with its four entrances welcoming all humanity regardless of caste, creed, or religion. The day also coincides with Jor Mela Sri Muktsar Sahib (Maghi), commemorating the sacrifice of the Chali Mukte (Forty Liberated Ones).

events.name: Baba Deep Singh Birthday
events.desc: Birthday Baba Deep Singh ji (14 Magh 556) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Baba Deep Singh Ji, a revered Sikh scholar and martyr known for his selfless service and sacrifice for the Sikh faith.

events.name: Masya
events.desc: Masya (16 Magh 556) - The new moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Basant Panchami
events.desc: Panchami, Basant Panchami, Marriage Day : Sri Guru Gobind Singh ji (Guru ka Lahore) (20 Magh 556) - Celebrates the arrival of spring and is also recognized as the marriage day of Sri Guru Gobind Singh Ji, which took place in Guru ka Lahore.

events.name: Dashmi
events.desc: Dashmi (25 Magh 556) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Wadda Ghallughara
events.desc: Wadda Ghallughara Kup Rohira (Sangrur) (27 Magh 556) - Commemorates the 'Greater Holocaust' of 1762, where a large number of Sikhs were massacred near Kup Rohira, a significant event in Sikh history marking resilience and sacrifice.

events.name: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Harirai Ji
events.desc: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Harirai ji (28 Magh 556) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sri Guru Harirai Ji, the seventh Guru of the Sikhs, known for his compassion and environmental stewardship.

events.name: Sahibzada Ajit Singh Birthday
events.desc: Birthday Sahibzada Ajit Singh ji (29 Magh 556) - Marks the birth anniversary of Sahibzada Ajit Singh Ji, the eldest son of Guru Gobind Singh Ji, revered for his bravery and sacrifice at the Battle of Chamkaur.

events.name: Sangrand (Phagun), Bhagat Ravidas Birthday
events.desc: Puranmashi, Birthday Bhagat Ravidas ji (01 Phagun 556) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Bhagat Ravidas Ji, a revered saint and poet whose hymns are included in the Sri Guru Granth Sahib, emphasizing social justice and equality.

events.name: Saka Sri Nankana Sahib
events.desc: Saka Sri Nankana Sahib (Pakistan), Jaitu Da Morcha (Faridkot) (10 Phagun 556) - Commemorates the tragic massacre at Sri Nankana Sahib in 1921, where peaceful Sikh protestors were killed, and Jaitu Da Morcha, a significant event in the Gurudwara Reform Movement.

events.name: Masya
events.desc: Masya (16 Phagun 556) - The new moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Panchami
events.desc: Panchami (21 Phagun 556) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Dashmi
events.desc: Dashmi (26 Phagun 556) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Sangrand (Chet), Punjabi New Year
events.desc: Puranmashi, Nanakshahi Punjabi New Year 557, Holi, Shaheedi Diwas Jathedar Akali Phula Singh ji (01 Chet 557) - Marks the beginning of the Nanakshahi calendar, the Sikh New Year, and coincides with the Hindu festival of Holi and the martyrdom day of Jathedar Akali Phula Singh Ji, a prominent Sikh leader.

events.name: Hola Mahalla
events.desc: Hola Mahalla Sri Anandpur Sahib, S. Baghel Singh Delhi Fateh (02 Chet 557) - A Sikh festival that takes place at Sri Anandpur Sahib, characterized by displays of martial arts, horsemanship, and community service, and commemorates S. Baghel Singh's conquest of Delhi.

events.name: Shaheed Bhagat Singh Day
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas S. Bhagat Singh (10 Chet 557) - A day to remember and honor Shaheed Bhagat Singh, a revolutionary freedom fighter who fought for India's independence.

events.name: Shaheedi Bhai Subeg Singh & Shahbaz Singh
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas Bhai Subeg Singh Bhai Shahbaz Singh (12 Chet 557) - Commemorates the martyrdom of Bhai Subeg Singh and his son Bhai Shahbaz Singh, who were executed for refusing to renounce their Sikh faith.

events.name: Gurgaddi Sri Guru Harirai Ji
events.desc: Gurgaddi Gurpurab Sri Guru Harirai ji (14 Chet 557) - Celebrates the day Sri Guru Harirai Ji assumed the Guruship, becoming the seventh Guru of the Sikhs.

events.name: Masya
events.desc: Masya (16 Chet 557) - The new moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Gurgaddi Sri Guru Amardas Ji
events.desc: Gurgaddi Gurpurab Sri Guru Amardas ji (17 Chet 557) - Marks the day Sri Guru Amardas Ji became the third Guru of the Sikhs, continuing the spiritual lineage.

events.name: Jyoti Jot Sri Guru Angad Dev Ji
events.desc: Jyoti jyot Gurpurab Sri Guru Angad Dev ji (19 Chet 557) - Observes the day Sri Guru Angad Dev Ji, the second Guru of the Sikhs, departed from this world.

events.name: Shaheedi Sri Guru Harigobind Ji
events.desc: Panchami, Jyoti jyot Gurpurab Sri Guru Harigobind ji (20 Chet 557) - Commemorates the day Sri Guru Harigobind Ji, the sixth Guru of the Sikhs, left this world, and is observed on Panchami.

events.name: Dashmi
events.desc: Dashmi (25 Chet 557) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Sahibzada Jujhar Singh Birthday
events.desc: Birthday Sahibzada Jujhar Singh ji (27 Chet 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sahibzada Jujhar Singh Ji, the second son of Guru Gobind Singh Ji, known for his valor and sacrifice at the Battle of Chamkaur.

events.name: Gurgaddi Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur Ji
events.desc: Gurgaddi Gurpurab Sri Guru Teg Bahadur ji, Jyoti jyot Gurpurab Sri Guru Harikrishan Sahib ji (29 Chet 557) - Marks the day Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur Ji assumed the Guruship and the day Sri Guru Harikrishan Sahib Ji departed from this world, remembered for his wisdom and compassion at a young age.

events.name: Puranmashi
events.desc: Puranmashi (30 Chet 557) - The full moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Sangrand (Vaisakh), Vaisakhi
events.desc: Vaisakhi (Baisakhi), Khalsa Foundation Day, Sikh Turban Day (01 Vaisakh 557) - The blessed day when Guru Gobind Singh Ji established the Khalsa Panth in 1699 at Sri Anandpur Sahib. The Guru created the order of the Khalsa through the sacred ceremony of Amrit Sanchar, blessing the Panj Pyare (Five Beloved Ones) who exemplified courage and dedication. This day marks the birth of the Khalsa tradition and celebrates the distinct identity of the Sikhs through the Five Ks (Kesh, Kangha, Kara, Kachera, and Kirpan). It also coincides with Sikh Turban Day, celebrating the significance of the turban in Sikh culture.

events.name: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur Ji
events.desc: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Teg Bahadur ji (06 Vaisakh 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur Ji, the ninth Guru of the Sikhs, revered for his sacrifice in defending religious freedom.

events.name: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Arjan Dev Ji
events.desc: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Arjan Dev ji, Birthday Bhagat Dhanna ji (08 Vaisakh 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sri Guru Arjan Dev Ji, the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, and the birthday of Bhagat Dhanna Ji, a devotee whose hymns are included in the Sri Guru Granth Sahib.

events.name: Masya
events.desc: Masya (15 Vaisakh 557) - The new moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Panchami
events.desc: Panchami (20 Vaisakh 557) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Shaheedi Jor Mela Sri Muktsar Sahib
events.desc: Shaheedi Jor Mela Sri Muktsar Sahib (21 Vaisakh 557) - Commemorates the martyrdom of the Chali Mukte (Forty Liberated Ones) who sacrificed their lives for Guru Gobind Singh Ji, a significant event in Sikh history.

events.name: Sardar Jassa Singh Ramgarhia Birthday
events.desc: Birthday Sardar Jassa Singh ji Ramgarhia (23 Vaisakh 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sardar Jassa Singh Ramgarhia, a prominent Sikh leader and warrior known for his contributions to Sikh military power.

events.name: Dashmi
events.desc: Dashmi (25 Vaisakh 557) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Amardas Ji
events.desc: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Amardas ji (29 Vaisakh 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sri Guru Amardas Ji, the third Guru of the Sikhs, known for his emphasis on equality and community service.

events.name: Baba Banda Singh Bahadar Fateh Divas
events.desc: Puranmashi, Baba Banda Singh Bahadar : Sirhind Fateh Divas (30 Vaisakh 557) - Commemorates the victory of Baba Banda Singh Bahadur over Sirhind, a significant event in Sikh history marking the establishment of Sikh rule in the region.

events.name: Sangrand (Jeth)
events.desc: Sangrand (Jeth) (01 Jeth 557) - The first day of the month of Jeth in the Nanakshahi calendar.

events.name: Chhota Ghallughara
events.desc: Chhota Ghallughara Kahnuwan (Gurdaspur) (03 Jeth 557) - Remembers the 'Lesser Holocaust' of 1746, where a large number of Sikhs were massacred near Kahnuwan, a significant event in Sikh history.

events.name: Sardar Jassa Singh Ahluwalia Birthday
events.desc: Birthday Sardar Jassa Singh Ahluwalia (05 Jeth 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sardar Jassa Singh Ahluwalia, a prominent Sikh leader and warrior known for his role in the Sikh Confederacy.

events.name: Gurgaddi Sri Guru Harigobind Ji
events.desc: Gurgaddi Gurpurab Sri Guru Harigobind ji (07 Jeth 557) - Marks the day Sri Guru Harigobind Ji became the sixth Guru of the Sikhs, known for his emphasis on both spiritual and martial strength (Miri and Piri).

events.name: Shaheedi Saka Paonta Sahib
events.desc: Shaheedi Saka Paonta Sahib (09 Jeth 557) - Commemorates the martyrdoms that occurred during the battle of Paonta Sahib, where Guru Gobind Singh Ji and his Sikhs fought against the combined forces of local hill chiefs.

events.name: Masya
events.desc: Masya (14 Jeth 557) - The new moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Shaheedi Sri Guru Arjan Dev Ji
events.desc: Shaheedi Gurpurab Sri Guru Arjan Dev ji (17 Jeth 557) - Commemorates the martyrdom of the fifth Guru who was martyred in 1606 in Lahore. Guru Arjan Dev Ji compiled the Adi Granth (Sri Guru Granth Sahib), built Sri Harmandir Sahib, and upheld truth and justice even in the face of extreme persecution. His martyrdom represents the Sikh principle of standing firm for one's beliefs and accepting God's will with grace.

events.name: Panchami
events.desc: Panchami (18 Jeth 557) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Sant Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale Birthday
events.desc: Birthday Sant Jarnail Singh ji Khalsa Bhindranwale (20 Jeth 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sant Jarnail Singh Ji Khalsa Bhindranwale, a controversial figure in Sikh history.

events.name: Operation Blue Star
events.desc: Ghallughara Sri Akal Takht Sahib (1984) (22 Jeth 557) - A controversial military operation carried out by the Indian government at Sri Akal Takht Sahib in Amritsar in 1984, a deeply sensitive event in Sikh history.

events.name: Dashmi
events.desc: Dashmi (23 Jeth 557) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Shaheedi Sant Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas Sant Jarnail Singh ji Khalsa Bhindranwale, Shaheedi Diwas Bhai Amreek Singh ji (24 Jeth 557) - Commemorates the death anniversary of Sant Jarnail Singh Ji Khalsa Bhindranwale and Bhai Amreek Singh Ji during Operation Blue Star.

events.name: Bhagat Kabir Birthday
events.desc: Puranmashi, Birthday Bhagat Kabir ji, Jor Mela Gurudwara Sri Reetha Sahib (29 Jeth 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Bhagat Kabir Ji, a revered saint and poet whose hymns are included in the Sri Guru Granth Sahib, and Jor Mela at Gurudwara Sri Reetha Sahib.

events.name: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Harigobind Ji
events.desc: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Harigobind ji (30 Jeth 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sri Guru Harigobind Ji, the sixth Guru of the Sikhs, known for his emphasis on both spiritual and martial strength (Miri and Piri).

events.name: Sangrand (Harh)
events.desc: Sangrand (Harh) (01 Harh 557) - The first day of the month of Harh in the Nanakshahi calendar.

events.name: Sri Akal Takht Foundation Day
events.desc: Sri Akal Takht Sahib Foundation Day (02 Harh 557) - Commemorates the establishment of Sri Akal Takht Sahib by Sri Guru Hargobind Ji in 1606, symbolizing temporal authority and justice.

events.name: Shaheedi Baba Banda Singh Bahadur
events.desc: Masya, Shaheedi Diwas Baba Banda Singh ji Bahadur (11 Harh 557) - Commemorates the martyrdom of Baba Banda Singh Bahadur, a prominent Sikh warrior who fought against Mughal rule in the early 18th century.

events.name: Maharaja Ranjit Singh Barsi
events.desc: Barsi Maharaja Ranjeet Singh ji (15 Harh 557) - Observes the death anniversary of Maharaja Ranjit Singh, the founder and ruler of the Sikh Empire, remembered for his just rule and patronage of the arts and culture.

events.name: Panchami
events.desc: Panchami (16 Harh 557) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Miri Piri Diwas
events.desc: Dashmi, Miri Piri Divas (Sri Guru Harigobind ji) (21 Harh 557) - Celebrates the concept of Miri and Piri (temporal and spiritual authority) as embodied by Sri Guru Harigobind Ji.

events.name: Shaheedi Bhai Mani Singh
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas Bhai Mani Singh ji (25 Harh 557) - Commemorates the martyrdom of Bhai Mani Singh Ji, a revered Sikh scholar and scribe who contributed significantly to the compilation of Sikh scriptures.

events.name: Puranmashi
events.desc: Puranmashi (26 Harh 557) - The full moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Sangrand (Sawan), Shaheedi Bhai Taru Singh
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas Bhai Taru Singh ji (01 Sawan 557) - Commemorates the martyrdom of Bhai Taru Singh Ji, known for his unwavering faith and sacrifice in the face of persecution.

events.name: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Harkishan Ji
events.desc: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Harikrishan ji (04 Sawan 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sri Guru Harikrishan Ji, the eighth Guru of the Sikhs, known for his compassion and healing powers.

events.name: Masya
events.desc: Masya (09 Sawan 557) - The new moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Panchami
events.desc: Panchami (14 Sawan 557) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Shaheed Udham Singh Day
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas S. Udham Singh ji (16 Sawan 557) - A day to remember and honor Shaheed Udham Singh, a revolutionary freedom fighter who assassinated Michael O'Dwyer to avenge the Jallianwala Bagh massacre.

events.name: Dashmi
events.desc: Dashmi (20 Sawan 557) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Guru Ka Bagh Morcha
events.desc: Morcha Guru Ka Baag (Sri Amritsar) (24 Sawan 557) - Commemorates the peaceful protest against the British government's interference in the management of Gurudwara Guru Ka Bagh, showcasing Sikh resilience and commitment to non-violent resistance.

events.name: Baba Bakala Mela
events.desc: Puranmashi, Jor Mela Baba Bakala (25 Sawan 557) - Celebrates the discovery of Guru Tegh Bahadur Ji as the ninth Guru at Baba Bakala, marked by a large gathering and festivities.

events.name: Sangrand (Bhadon)
events.desc: Sangrand (Bhadon) (01 Bhadon 557) - The first day of the month of Bhadon in the Nanakshahi calendar.

events.name: Shaheedi Sant Harchand Singh Longowal
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas Sant Harchand Singh ji Longowal (05 Bhadon 557) - Commemorates the death anniversary of Sant Harchand Singh Longowal, a prominent Sikh leader who played a key role in the Punjab Accord.

events.name: Masya
events.desc: Masya (08 Bhadon 557) - The new moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: First Parkash Sri Guru Granth Sahib Ji
events.desc: Pehla Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Granth Sahib ji (09 Bhadon 557) - Celebrates the first installation of the Sri Guru Granth Sahib at Sri Harmandir Sahib, marking its significance as the eternal Guru of the Sikhs.

events.name: Gurgaddi Sri Guru Arjan Dev Ji
events.desc: Gurgaddi Gurpurab Sri Guru Arjan Dev ji (10 Bhadon 557) - Marks the day Sri Guru Arjan Dev Ji became the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, continuing the spiritual lineage.

events.name: Jyoti Jot Sri Guru Ramdas Ji
events.desc: Jyoti jyot Gurpurab Sri Guru Ramdas ji (11 Bhadon 557) - Observes the day Sri Guru Ramdas Ji, the fourth Guru of the Sikhs, departed from this world.

events.name: Panchami
events.desc: Panchami (13 Bhadon 557) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Sri Guru Granth Sahib Sampurnta Diwas
events.desc: Sampooranta Divas Sri Guru Granth Sahib ji (14 Bhadon 557) - Commemorates the completion of the Sri Guru Granth Sahib, the holy scripture of the Sikhs.

events.name: Sri Guru Nanak Dev Ji Marriage Day
events.desc: Jor Mela Gurudwara Kandh Sahib (Batala), Gurudwara Dehra Sahib : Marriage Day : Sri Guru Nanak Dev ji (Batala) (15 Bhadon 557) - Celebrates the marriage of Sri Guru Nanak Dev Ji, the founder of Sikhism, with festivities held at Gurudwara Kandh Sahib in Batala.

events.name: Dashmi
events.desc: Dashmi (18 Bhadon 557) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Gurgaddi Sri Guru Ramdas Ji
events.desc: Gurgaddi Gurpurab Sri Guru Ramdas ji (21 Bhadon 557) - Marks the day Sri Guru Ramdas Ji became the fourth Guru of the Sikhs, known for founding the city of Amritsar.

events.name: Jyoti Jot Sri Guru Amardas Ji
events.desc: Puranmashi, Jyoti jyot Gurpurab Sri Guru Amardas ji, Jor Mela Govindwaal Sahib (23 Bhadon 557) - Observes the day Sri Guru Amardas Ji, the third Guru of the Sikhs, departed from this world, and is marked by a large gathering at Govindwaal Sahib.

events.name: Baba Buddha Ji Mela
events.desc: Jor Mela Baba Buddha ji (Ramdas) (27 Bhadon 555) - Celebrates the life and contributions of Baba Buddha Ji, a revered Sikh saint, with a large gathering at Ramdas.

events.name: Gurgaddi Sri Guru Angad Dev Ji
events.desc: Gurgaddi Gurpurab Sri Guru Angad Dev ji (28 Bhadon 557) - Marks the day Sri Guru Angad Dev Ji became the second Guru of the Sikhs, continuing the spiritual lineage.

events.name: Sangrand (Assu), Jyoti Jot Sri Guru Nanak Dev Ji
events.desc: Jyoti jyot Gurpurab Sri Guru Nanak Dev ji (01 Assu 557) - Observes the day Sri Guru Nanak Dev Ji, the founder of Sikhism, departed from this world.

events.name: Masya
events.desc: Masya (06 Assu 557) - The new moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Panchami
events.desc: Panchami (12 Assu 557) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Dussehra
events.desc: Dashmi, Darbar Khalsa (Dussehra) (17 Assu 557) - Celebrates the Hindu festival of Dussehra, also known as Vijayadashami, marking the victory of good over evil, and is observed by Sikhs as Darbar Khalsa.

events.name: Bir Baba Buddha Ji Mela
events.desc: Jor Mela Bir Baba Buddha ji (Thatha) (21 Assu 557) - Celebrates the life and contributions of Baba Buddha Ji, a revered Sikh saint, with a large gathering at Thatha.

events.name: Bir Baba Buddha Ji Mela
events.desc: Puranmashi, Jor Mela Bir Baba Buddha ji (Thatha) (22 Assu 557) - Celebrates the life and contributions of Baba Buddha Ji, a revered Sikh saint, with a large gathering at Thatha.

events.name: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Ramdas Ji
events.desc: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Ramdas ji (23 Assu 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sri Guru Ramdas Ji, the fourth Guru of the Sikhs, known for founding the city of Amritsar.

events.name: Bhai Sukha Jinda Shaheedi
events.desc: Birthday Bhai Taru Singh ji, Shaheedi Diwas Bhai Sukhdev Singh (Sukha) Bhai Harjinder Singh (Jinda) (24 Assu 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Bhai Taru Singh Ji, a revered Sikh martyr, and commemorates the martyrdom of Bhai Sukhdev Singh (Sukha) and Bhai Harjinder Singh (Jinda), known for their role in the Sikh struggle.

events.name: Gurgaddi Sri Guru Harkishan Ji
events.desc: Jyoti jyot Gurpurab Sri Guru Harirai ji, Gurgaddi Gurpurab Sri Guru Harikrishan ji (30 Assu 557) - Observes the day Sri Guru Harirai Ji, the seventh Guru of the Sikhs, departed from this world, and marks the day Sri Guru Harikrishan Ji became the eighth Guru of the Sikhs.

events.name: Sangrand (Katak)
events.desc: Sangrand (Katak) (01 Katak 557) - The first day of the month of Katak in the Nanakshahi calendar.

events.name: Diwali
events.desc: Masya, Bandi Chor Divas (Diwali), Birthday Sant Gyani Kartar Singh ji Bhindranwale (05 Katak 557) - Celebrates Diwali, the festival of lights, and Bandi Chor Divas, marking the release of Guru Hargobind Ji from imprisonment, and the birth anniversary of Sant Gyani Kartar Singh Ji Bhindranwale.

events.name: Gurgaddi Sri Guru Granth Sahib Ji
events.desc: Gurgaddi Gurpurab Sri Guru Granth Sahib ji, Birthday Baba Budha ji (Kathunangal), Barsi Sardar Jassa Singh Ahluwalia (07 Katak 557) - Marks the day Sri Guru Granth Sahib Ji was declared the eternal Guru of the Sikhs, celebrates the birth anniversary of Baba Budha Ji, a revered Sikh saint, and observes the death anniversary of Sardar Jassa Singh Ahluwalia, a prominent Sikh leader.

events.name: Jyoti Jot Sri Guru Gobind Singh Ji
events.desc: Panchami, Jyoti jyot Gurpurab Sri Guru Gobind Singh ji (10 Katak 557) - Observes the day Sri Guru Gobind Singh Ji, the tenth Guru of the Sikhs, departed from this world, and is observed on Panchami.

events.name: Saka Panja Sahib
events.desc: Saka Panja Sahib (Pakistan) (14 Katak 557) - Commemorates the tragic massacre at Panja Sahib in 1922, where peaceful Sikh protestors were killed.

events.name: Shaheed Bhai Beant Singh Day
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas Bhai Beant Singh (15 Katak 557) - Commemorates the martyrdom of Bhai Beant Singh, known for his role in avenging the desecration of Sri Akal Takht Sahib.

events.name: Punjab Day
events.desc: Dashmi, Punjab Day (16 Katak 557) - Celebrates Punjab Day, marking the reorganization of the state of Punjab in 1966.

events.name: Bhagat Namdev Birthday
events.desc: Birthday Bhagat Namdev ji (17 Katak 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Bhagat Namdev Ji, a revered saint and poet whose hymns are included in the Sri Guru Granth Sahib.

events.name: Mata Sahib Kaur Birthday
events.desc: Birthday Mata Sahib Kaur ji (18 Katak 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Mata Sahib Kaur Ji, revered as the mother of the Khalsa.

events.name: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Nanak Dev Ji
events.desc: Puranmashi, Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Nanak Dev ji (20 Katak 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sri Guru Nanak Dev Ji, the founder of Sikhism, observed on the full moon day.

events.name: Shaheedi Baba Deep Singh Ji
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas Baba Deep Singh ji, SGPC Foundation Day (30 Katak 557) - Commemorates the martyrdom of Baba Deep Singh Ji, a revered Sikh scholar and warrior, and marks the foundation day of the Shiromani Gurudwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC).

events.name: Sangrand (Maghar)
events.desc: Sangrand (Maghar) (01 Maghar 557) - The first day of the month of Maghar in the Nanakshahi calendar.

events.name: Masya
events.desc: Masya (05 Maghar 557) - The new moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: 350th Gurgaddi Sri Guru Gobind Singh Ji
events.desc: Gurgaddi Gurpurab Sri Guru Gobind Singh ji (350 years) (08 Maghar 557) - Marks the 350th anniversary of Sri Guru Gobind Singh Ji assuming the Guruship, the tenth Guru of the Sikhs.

events.name: 350th Shaheedi Bhai Dayala-Mati-Sati Das
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas Bhai Dayala ji Bhai Matidas ji Bhai Satidas ji (350 years) (09 Maghar 557) - Commemorates the 350th anniversary of the martyrdom of Bhai Dayala Ji, Bhai Mati Das Ji, and Bhai Sati Das Ji, who were executed for their unwavering faith in Sikhism.

events.name: 350th Shaheedi Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur Ji
events.desc: Shaheedi Gurpurab Sri Guru Teg Bahadur ji (350 years) (10 Maghar 557) - The sacred martyrdom day of the ninth Guru, who sacrificed his life protecting religious freedom and human rights. Known as 'Hind Di Chadar' (Shield of India), Guru Tegh Bahadur Ji gave his life defending the right of people to practice their faith freely, exemplifying the Sikh principle of standing up against tyranny and protecting the oppressed.

events.name: Bhai Mardana Ji Barsi
events.desc: Akal Chalana Bhai Mardana ji (13 Maghar 557) - Observes the death anniversary of Bhai Mardana Ji, a close companion of Guru Nanak Dev Ji and a revered figure in Sikh history.

events.name: Sahibzada Zorawar Singh Birthday
events.desc: Dashmi, Birthday Sahibzada Zorawar Singh ji (15 Maghar 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sahibzada Zorawar Singh Ji, the younger son of Guru Gobind Singh Ji, known for his bravery and sacrifice.

events.name: Shaheedi Baba Gurbaksh Singh
events.desc: Puranmashi, Shaheedi Diwas Baba Gurbaksh Singh ji (19 Maghar 557) - Commemorates the martyrdom of Baba Gurbaksh Singh Ji, a revered Sikh warrior.

events.name: Sahibzada Fateh Singh Birthday
events.desc: Birthday Sahibzada Fateh Singh ji, Shiromani Akali Dal Foundation day (29 Maghar 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sahibzada Fateh Singh Ji, the younger son of Guru Gobind Singh Ji, known for his bravery and sacrifice, and marks the foundation day of the Shiromani Akali Dal.

events.name: Sangrand (Poh)
events.desc: Sangrand (Poh) (01 Poh 557) - The first day of the month of Poh in the Nanakshahi calendar.

events.name: Masya
events.desc: Masya (05 Poh 557) - The new moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Evacuation Sri Anandgarh Fort
events.desc: Leaving Fort Sri Anandgarh Sahib (06 Poh 557) - Commemorates the evacuation of Sri Anandgarh Fort by Guru Gobind Singh Ji and his Sikhs during the Mughal siege.

events.name: Family Separation Day
events.desc: Family Separation (Sarsa Nangal), Shaheedi Diwas Baba Jivan Singh ji (Bhai Jaita ji) (07 Poh 557) - Remembers the day Guru Gobind Singh Ji's family was separated at Sarsa Nangal during the Mughal siege, and commemorates the martyrdom of Baba Jivan Singh Ji (Bhai Jaita Ji), a devoted Sikh who retrieved the head of Guru Tegh Bahadur Ji.

events.name: Shaheedi Vadde Sahibzade
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas Wadde Sahibzade (Chamkaur Sahib) (08 Poh 557) - Commemorates the martyrdom of Guru Gobind Singh Ji's elder sons, Sahibzada Ajit Singh and Sahibzada Jujhar Singh, who attained martyrdom fighting with remarkable courage at the Battle of Chamkaur. Despite their young age, they exemplified the Sikh principles of standing against injustice and maintaining dignity in the face of overwhelming odds.

events.name: Shaheedi Bhai Sangat Singh
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas Bhai Sangat Singh ji (09 Poh 557) - Commemorates the martyrdom of Bhai Sangat Singh Ji, a devoted Sikh who fought alongside Guru Gobind Singh Ji at the Battle of Chamkaur.

events.name: Panchami
events.desc: Panchami (11 Poh 557) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Guru Gobind Singh Prakash
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas Chhote Sahibzade and Mata Gujari ji, Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Gobind Singh ji (13 Poh 557) - Guru Gobind Singh Ji, born in 1666, was the tenth Guru of Sikhism and the founder of the Khalsa in 1699.

events.name: Dashmi
events.desc: Dashmi (15 Poh 557) - A day in the lunar calendar observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Puranmashi
events.desc: Puranmashi (20 Poh 557) - The full moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Shaheedi Bhai Kehar & Satwant Singh
events.desc: Shaheedi Diwas Bhai Kehar Singh Bhai Satwant Singh (23 Poh 557) - Bhai Kehar Singh and Bhai Satwant Singh attained martyrdom in 1989 for their role in avenging the desecration of Sri Akal Takht Sahib.

events.name: Sri Harimandir Sahib Foundation Day
events.desc: Foundation day Sachkhand Sri Harimandir Sahib (Amritsar), Jor Mela Sri Muktsar Sahib (Maghi) (01 Magh 557) - The foundation of Sri Harimandir Sahib was laid in 1581 by Guru Arjan Dev Ji, serving as the spiritual and cultural epicenter of Sikhism.

events.name: Masya
events.desc: Masya (05 Magh 557) - The new moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Chabian Da Morcha
events.desc: Chabiyan Da Morcha (Amritsar) (07 Magh 557) - Commemorates the peaceful protest against the British government's interference in the management of Gurudwara Chabiyan Da Morcha, showcasing Sikh resilience and commitment to non-violent resistance.

events.name: Basant Panchami
events.desc: Panchami, Basant Panchami, Marriage Day : Sri Guru Gobind Singh ji (Guru ka Lahore) (10 Magh 557) - Celebrates the arrival of spring and is also recognized as the marriage day of Sri Guru Gobind Singh Ji, which took place in Guru ka Lahore.

events.name: Baba Deep Singh Birthday
events.desc: Birthday Baba Deep Singh ji (14 Magh 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Baba Deep Singh Ji, a revered Sikh scholar and martyr known for his selfless service and sacrifice for the Sikh faith.

events.name: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Harirai Ji
events.desc: Prakash Gurpurab Sri Guru Harirai Sahib ji (18 Magh 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Sri Guru Harirai Ji, the seventh Guru of the Sikhs, known for his compassion and environmental stewardship.

events.name: Bhagat Ravidas Birthday
events.desc: Puranmashi, Birthday Bhagat Ravidas ji (19 Magh 557) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Bhagat Ravidas Ji, a revered saint and poet whose hymns are included in the Sri Guru Granth Sahib, emphasizing social justice and equality.

events.name: Wadda Ghallughara
events.desc: Wadda Ghallughara Kup Rohira (Sangrur) (27 Magh 557) - Commemorates the 'Greater Holocaust' of 1762, where a large number of Sikhs were massacred near Kup Rohira, a significant event in Sikh history marking resilience and sacrifice.

events.name: Sahibzada Ajit Singh Birthday
events.desc: Birthday Sahibzada Ajit Singh ji (29 Magh 557) - Marks the birth anniversary of Sahibzada Ajit Singh Ji, the eldest son of Guru Gobind Singh Ji, revered for his bravery and sacrifice at the Battle of Chamkaur.

events.name: Sangrand (Phagun)
events.desc: Sangrand (Phagun) (01 Phagun 557) - The first day of the month of Phagun in the Nanakshahi calendar.

events.name: Masya
events.desc: Masya (06 Phagun 557) - The new moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Saka Sri Nankana Sahib
events.desc: Saka Sri Nankana Sahib (Pakistan), Jaitu Da Morcha (Faridkot) (10 Phagun 557) - Commemorates the tragic massacre at Sri Nankana Sahib in 1921, where peaceful Sikh protestors were killed, and Jaitu Da Morcha, a significant event in the Gurudwara Reform Movement.

events.name: Puranmashi
events.desc: Puranmashi (20 Phagun 557) - The full moon day in the lunar calendar, observed by Sikhs.

events.name: Hola Mahalla
events.desc: Hola Mahalla (21 Phagun 557) - A Sikh festival that takes place at Sri Anandpur Sahib, characterized by displays of martial arts, horsemanship, and community service.

events.name: Sangrand (Chet) Punjabi New Year
events.desc: Nanakshahi Punjabi New Year 558 (01 Chet 558) - Marks the beginning of the Nanakshahi calendar, the Sikh New Year.
